intro: Chaetanthera splendens, commonly known as the splendour bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Chaetanthera splendens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
